overview_of_class: Focuses on social science theories that help explain why and how individuals, families, and groups acquire, consume, and dispose of goods, services, ideas, brands, and experiences. Emphasizes the goals and experiences people have to better understand them as consumers. Examines psychological, economic, communication, anthropological, and sociological perspectives on human action that provide insight into consumer behavior. Prerequisites: sophomore standing.
name: Consumer Insight
title: JOUR IMC 301-0-21 Consumer Insight
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Reserved for IMC Certificate Students only.

Emphasizes the goals and experiences people have to better understand them as consumers. Examines psychological, economic, communication, anthropological, and sociological perspectives on human action that provide insight into consumer behavior. Prerequisites: sophomore standing.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Solomon, Michael Consumer Behavior, 10th Edition, ISBN: 0132671840
